1.text: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats bring forth among the rocks, or hast thou observed the hinds when they fawn?

2.text: Hast thou numbered the months of their conceiving, or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

3.text: They bow themselves to bring forth young, and they cast them, and send forth roarings.

4.text: Their young are weaned and go to feed : they go forth, and return not to them.

5.text: Who hath sent out the wild ass free, and who hath loosed his bonds?

6.text: To whom I have given a house in the wilderness, and his dwellings in the barren land.

7.text: He scorneth the multitude of the city, he heareth not the cry of the driver.

8.text: He looketh round about the mountains of his pasture, and seeketh for every green thing.

9.text: Shall the rhinoceros be willing to serve thee, or will he stay at thy crib?

10.text: Canst thou bind the rhinoceros with thy thong to plough, or will he break the clods of the valleys after thee?

11.text: Wilt thou have confidence in his great strength, and leave thy labours to him?

12.text: Wilt thou trust him that he will render thee the seed, and gather it into thy barnfloor?

13.text: The wing of the ostrich is like the wings of the heron, and of the hawk.

14.text: When she leaveth her eggs on the earth, thou perhaps wilt warm them in the dust.

15.text: She forgetteth that the foot may tread upon them, or that the beasts of the field may break them.

16.text: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers, she hath laboured in vain, no fear constraining her.

17.text: For God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he given her understanding.

18.text: When time shall be, she setteth up her wings on high : she scorneth the horse and his rider.

19.text: Wilt thou give strength to the horse, or clothe his neck with neighing?

20.text: Wilt thou lift him up like the locusts? the glory of his nostrils is terror.

21.text: He breaketh up the earth with his hoof, he pranceth boldly, he goeth forward to meet armed men.

22.text: He despiseth fear, he turneth not his back to the sword,

23.text: Above him shall the quiver rattle, the spear and shield shall glitter.

24.text: Chasing and raging he swalloweth the ground, neither doth he make account when the noise of the trumpet soundeth.

25.text: When he heareth the trumpet he saith : Ha, ha : he smelleth the battle afar off, the encouraging of the captains, and the shouting of the army.

26.text: Doth the hawk wax feathered by thy wisdom, spreading her wings to the south?

27.text: Will the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest in high places?

28.text: She abideth among the rocks, and dwelleth among cragged flints, and stony hills, where there is no access.

29.text: From thence she looketh for the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.

30.text: Her young ones shall suck up blood : and wheresoever the carcass shall be, she is immediately there.
